page.title: 03NATURAL HISTORY IN WOLSTON
page.content: {The brook}which runs through Wolston comes from two pits which have spring-water (Ferry Farm) and it is never known to have run dry.{The River {Avon}runs through{Wolston Woods}and the last time the children visited the woods they wrote "We found lots of trees such as beech, yew, sycamore, ash, holly, willow and Scotspine. There was even a rare tree called a Redwood. These trees are in the woods because a long time ago they were part of the garden of the Old Manor House. Some trees had been damaged by vandals who had tried to burn them. This is a shame because the trees are there for everyone to share and enjoy. In the spring there are lots of snowdrops but many of these are lost forever because Coventry people come in cars and dig up the bulbs." A{rare flower,}white butterbur, was found there in 1968.
